title: How are ukulele strings numbered? - Quora

response.answer_text: Think of them as the floors in a building. The first string is closest to the floor and number four is closest to the sky. From top to bottom the standard tuning is G-C-E-A with the C note being the lowest note. This is called re-entrant tuning.
Uke strings are numbered the same as any other strings 1–4 right to left facing the instrument, even though the #4 G string is tuned higher. 1 A,2 E, 3 C, 4G
